Class GameArena

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameArena

  • public class GameArena
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a simple window in which grahical objects can be drawn. Instances of the Ball and Rectangle classes can be added to an instance of this class to draw and animate simple shapes on the screen. Note: Patched to prevent mulitple render objects with the same key, thus losing the render object reference
    Author:
    Joe Finney
    See Also:
    Ball, Rectangle

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameArena

        public GameArena(int width,
                 int height)
        Constructor. Creates an instance of the GameArena class, and displays a window on the screen upon which shapes can be drawn.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the window, in pixels.
        height - The height of the window, in pixels.

      • GameArena

        public GameArena(int width,
                 int height,
                 boolean createWindow)
        Constructor. Creates an instance of the GameArena class, and displays a window on the screen upon which shapes can be drawn.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the window, in pixels.
        height - The height of the window, in pixels.
        createWindow - Determines if a JFrame containing the GameArena should be created (true) or not (false).

    • Method Detail

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Close this GameArena window.

      • getObjectCount

        public int getObjectCount()
        Sums the sizes of all internal object maps to produce a count of all currently rendered objects Note: This will be accurate between update()s, as it accounts for any on the add queue
        Returns:
        The number of objects ready to render

      • addBall

        public void addBall(Ball b)
        Adds a given Ball to the GameArena. Once a Ball is added, it will automatically appear on the window.
        Parameters:
        b - the ball to add to the GameArena.

      • removeBall

        public void removeBall(Ball b)
        Remove a Ball from the GameArena. Once a Ball is removed, it will no longer appear on the window.
        Parameters:
        b - the ball to remove from the GameArena.

      • removeRectangle

        public void removeRectangle(Rectangle r)

        Parameters:
        r - the rectangle to remove from the GameArena.

      • update

        public void update()
        Update the window to reflect all graphical objects added to this GameArena. This method will update the window to reflect the size, colour and position of all graphical objects (Balls, Rectangles etc). You must call this method each time you want the screen to update. This method also waits for approximately 1/50 of a second (the time it takes your computer display to refresh). You'll find this useful if you're trying to animate your application.
